entries.meaning: (now historical) An old gold coin of Italy; a sequin. [from 16th c.]
examples: [T]he modern Philosophy holds the Eternity of the Earth, or at least an Antiquity of 50,000 Years; & Mr. Byers gets thirty Zecchines apiece for his Infidel Lectures from all the English who travel thro' Rome  [â€¦] .
